_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility:  MFA Agri Service King City

Location:  4698 US Highway 169, King City, MO 64463

Contact:  Matt Swank

Phone:  (660) 535-4461



1.  Facility Policy



MFA Incorporated and the employees of MFA Agri Service King City are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Gentry County LEPC and other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impacts of the release to people and the environment.



2.  Stationary Source and Regulated Substance Handled



The facility operates an anhydrous ammonia storage facility and sells the regulated substance, anhydrous ammonia, for direct application as a crop nutrient.



3.  The Accidental Release Prevention Program



The Accidental Release Prevention Program for the location consists of following the provisions of:



a.    40 CFR Part 68

b.    OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111

c.    Missouri Anhydrous Ammonia Law

d.    CGA G.2.1 - 2014



4.  Five-Year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program



The facility has;



a. a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



b. provided State and Local authorities with the emergency planning and community

   right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);



c. employees will not respond to any release other than to activate emergency shut-off valves

   while evacuating the facility if it is safe for them to do so.  Local responders will be notified to 

   control any release.



6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluatio

ns are performed to assess the condition and operation of the facility and improvements are made where warranted.



5/14/21
